conclusion: Need to analyze the v-t graph to determine if the particle underwent variable linear motion in the first 3 seconds.
The v-t graph shows velocity as a function of time, with time on the x-axis and velocity on the y-axis.
From t = 0 to t = 1 second, the velocity is constant at v = 2 m/s.
Uniform motion (constant velocity) occurs from t = 0 to t = 1 second.
From t = 1 to t = 2 seconds, the velocity decreases linearly from v = 2 m/s to v = 0 m/s.
Variable linear motion (changing velocity) occurs from t = 1 to t = 2 seconds.
From t = 2 to t = 3 seconds, the velocity decreases linearly from v = 0 m/s to v = -2 m/s.
Variable linear motion (changing velocity) occurs from t = 2 to t = 3 seconds.
The particle undergoes variable linear motion from t = 1 to t = 3 seconds and not from t = 0 to t = 1 second.
Yes, the particle underwent variable linear motion in the first 3 seconds.
